artworks.title: The Starry Night
artworks.author: Vincent Van Gogh
artworks.description: It depicts the view from the east-facing window of the author's asylum room at Saint-Rémy-de-Provence, just before sunrise, with the addition of an imaginary village.

artworks.title: Mona Lisa
artworks.author: Leonardo da Vinci
artworks.description: A portrait of a woman, widely believed to be Lisa Gherardini, known for her enigmatic expression. This artwork is one of the most famous and recognized paintings in the world.

artworks.title: The Persistence of Memory
artworks.author: Salvador Dalí
artworks.description: Famous for its surrealistic depiction of melting clocks draped over a landscape, this painting explores the concept of time and its fluidity.

artworks.title: Girl with a Pearl Earring
artworks.author: Johannes Vermeer
artworks.description: Often referred to as the 'Mona Lisa of the North,' this painting captures a young woman wearing an exotic dress and a large pearl earring, looking back over her shoulder.

artworks.title: The Scream
artworks.author: Edvard Munch
artworks.medium: Oil, tempera, and pastel on cardboard
artworks.description: An iconic piece of modern art, this expressionist painting depicts a figure with an agonized expression against a turbulent sky, symbolizing existential angst.

artworks.title: The Birth of Venus
artworks.author: Sandro Botticelli
artworks.description: This Renaissance masterpiece portrays the goddess Venus emerging from the sea on a shell, symbolizing beauty and love. It's celebrated for its graceful composition and mythological significance.
